discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
When a file in the GLACIER storage class is requested for retrieval (restore), Amazon S3 initiates a Glacier restore job to make the file accessible again in the S3 Standard storage class. Once the restoration process is completed, Amazon S3 generates an s3:ObjectCreated:Completed event, indicating that the object has been restored and is available for access.

To receive a notification when the restoration is complete and the file is accessible, you can enable S3 event notification for the s3:ObjectCreated:Completed event on the S3 bucket containing the Glacier object. The event notification can be configured to send a notification to an Amazon SNS topic that the Administrator has subscribed to.

questions.question_text:
An Application Load Balancer (ALB) is configured in front of Amazon EC2 instances. The current target group health check configuration is:
✑ Interval: 30 seconds
✑ Unhealthy threshold: 10
✑ Healthy threshold: 5
Which steps should a SysOps Administrator take to reduce the amount of time needed to remove unhealthy instances? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: BE as you are trying to reduce the time, thus reduce the interval period and the count

B. Change the interval configuration to 15. 
E. Change the unhealthy threshold configuration to 5.

Selected Answer: BE
B. Change the interval configuration to 15.

By reducing the interval from 30 seconds to 15 seconds, the ALB will check the health of the instances more frequently. This will allow it to detect unhealthy instances sooner and take appropriate action to remove them from the target group more quickly.

E. Change the unhealthy threshold configuration to 5.

By reducing the unhealthy threshold from 10 to 5, the ALB will consider an instance unhealthy after only 5 consecutive failed health checks instead of 10. With a lower threshold, the ALB will trigger the removal of unhealthy instances from the target group more quickly.
